meanings.definition: To scatter among or between other things
meanings.sent1: She inters the flowers in the garden for a beautiful mix of colors.
meanings.sent2: The teacher inters the stickers on the students' notebooks as rewards.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel inters acorns among the leaves to play hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: The stars inters the night sky like diamonds on black velvet.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully inters paint on the canvas to create a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To place at intervals or among other things
meanings.sent1: He inters the flags along the parade route for a festive atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: The chef inters herbs in the dish to enhance the flavors.
meanings.sent3: The magician inters surprises throughout his performance to keep the audience guessing.
meanings.sent4: The memories inters themselves in her mind like scattered puzzle pieces.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight inters through the trees, creating a dappled effect on the ground.

meanings.definition: To insert or introduce between other elements
meanings.sent1: The editor inters helpful comments in the manuscript for the author's review.
meanings.sent2: She inters jokes in her speech to keep the audience engaged.
meanings.sent3: The comedian inters witty remarks between his punchlines for added humor.
meanings.sent4: The melody inters unexpected notes, creating a unique musical composition.
meanings.sent5: The architect inters modern elements into the traditional design for a fresh look.
